conclusion: Consider the method of images to solve the problem involving conductors and point charges.
An image charge -q must be placed at (0, 0, -h) to ensure the electric field inside the conductor is zero.
Calculate the electric field due to the original charge +q at (h, h, -h).
Determine the distance r from +q to (h, h, -h) as h√6.
Calculate the unit vector r̂ from (0,0,h) to (h,h,-h) as (î + ĵ - 2k̂)/√6.
Determine the electric field E_original due to +q as kq/(6h²√6) (î + ĵ - 2k̂).
Calculate the electric field due to the image charge -q at (h, h, -h).
Determine the distance r' from -q to (h, h, -h) as h√2.
Calculate the unit vector r̂' from (0,0,-h) to (h,h,-h) as (î + ĵ)/√2.
Determine the electric field E_image due to -q as k(-q)/(2h²√2) (î + ĵ).
